English: You look fine! You're not hurt!
Chinese:
……你沒事吧！
沒有哪裡受傷了吧！
Korean:
……무사했었구나!
어디 다친데 없지!
German:
Dir scheint es gut zu gehen! Du bist nicht
verletzt!

English:
Wipe that look off your face! Of course I'd be
worried about you!
Chinese:
你那什麼搞不清楚狀況的表情啊！
我當然是在擔心你啊！！
Korean:
뭘 느긋한 얼굴을 하고 있는 거야!
걱정하는 게 당연하잖아!!
German:
Schau nicht so! Natürlich mache ich mir Sorgen
um dich!

English:
Out of nowhere my best friend told me he's joined
a team of hackers, then I lost contact with him!
Chinese:
好朋友突然說「我要加入駭客團體」
然後就失去連絡了耶！？
Korean:
친구가 갑자기「해커 팀에 들어가」라더니
연락이 끊겨버렸다고!?
German:
Urplötzlich erzählt mir mein bester Freund, dass
er bei einem Hackerteam mitmacht, und dann
höre ich nichts mehr von ihm!

English:
Are you okay? They didn't do anything nasty to
you, did they? Tell me every little detail!
Chinese:
你沒事吧？沒有被怎麼樣吧！？
到底發生了什麼，詳細說給我聽！
Korean:
괜찮은 거야? 심각한 짓을 당하진 않았지!?
무슨 일이 있었는지 제대로 들려줘!
German:
Alles klar bei dir? Die haben doch nichts Fieses
mit dir angestellt, oder? Erzähl mir alle
Einzelheiten!

English:
So then...this "Ryuji" guy invited you to join his
hacker team, huh?
Chinese:
所以……你就答應了那個叫龍司的邀請，
加入了駭客團體啊。
Korean:
그래서… 그 류지라는 녀석의 권유를 받아들여서
해커팀에 들어갔다는 건가
German:
Und dann ... hat dieser „Ryuji“ dich gebeten, bei
seinem Hackerteam mitzumachen, was?

English: What the heck're you thinking, man?!
Chinese: 你到底在想什麼啊！
Korean: 너, 무슨 생각을 하는 거야!
German: Was zum Teufel denkst du dir dabei?!

English:
Hackers are the type of scum that raided your
account in the first place!
Chinese: 駭客可是跟獵走你帳號的傢伙是同一種人耶！
Korean:
해커 따위, 네 계정을 사냥한 녀석들과
같은 인종이잖아!
German:
Hacker sind doch der Abschaum, der deinen Account
gestohlen hat!

English: How can you trust people like that?!
Chinese: 而你居然還相信那種人──！
Korean: 그런 놈들을 신뢰하다니――!
German: Wie kannst du solchen Leuten nur trauen?!

English: Hey...what's with the silent treatment?
Chinese: 幹、幹麼啊……都不說話。
Korean: 뭐, 뭐야… 갑자기 조용해져서는
German: Hey ... Warum schweigst du mich denn an?

English:
Not all hackers are bad.
You really were worried about me, weren't you?
Chinese:
駭客也不全都是壞人喔
讓你擔心了呢
Korean:
해커는 나쁜 놈들만 있는 게 아냐
걱정해줬구나
German:
Nicht alle Hacker sind böse.
Du hast dir wirklich Sorgen um mich gemacht?

English:
...Hmm. Well, if you say so, I'll believe you.
Still, keep your guard up.
Chinese:
……唉……你都這麼說了，那我就相信他們吧。
但你可別忘了要提高警戒啊。
Korean:
……뭐어…… 네가 그렇게까지 얘기한다면 믿겠지만 말이야.
각별히 주의하라고
German:
... Hm. Na, wenn du meinst, glaube ich es dir.
Sei aber trotzdem vorsichtig.

English: Of, of course! You're my best bud, man.
Chinese: 這、這是當然的啊！　我們是好朋友耶！
Korean: 다, 당연하잖아! 친구니까
German:
Aber klar doch! Du bist doch mein allerbester
Freund.

English:
So even with their help, you still couldn't find
the criminal after all, huh?
Chinese:
只是……雖然借助了他們的力量，
卻依然不知道犯人到底是誰啊。
Korean:
하지만… 그 녀석들의 힘을 빌렸어도
결국 범인은 알 수 없었구나
German:
Selbst mit ihrer Hilfe konntest du den
Verbrecher doch nicht finden, was?

English:
Still...you don't seem all that upset about it,
you know? Did something happen?
Chinese:
但是……你怎麼還能這麼平靜啊？
發生什麼了嗎？
Korean:
어쩐지…… 그런 것치곤 너, 기죽지 않았네?
무슨 일 있었어?
German:
Aber ... du scheinst nicht besonders wütend
deswegen zu sein, oder? Ist etwas passiert?

English:
I think I'll find him if I stay in Hudie.
I can get more information from K.
Seeing your face cheered me up.
Chinese:
我覺得只要在hudie，就會有找到的機會
能再從K那獲得情報就好了呢
看見優之後我就有精神了喔
Korean:
후디에에 있으면 조만간 찾을 것 같아
다시 K로부터 정보를 받으면 돼
유우의 얼굴을 보니 기운이 났어
German:
Wenn ich bei Hudie bleibe, finde ich ihn.
K hat mehr Informationen für mich.
Ich freue mich so, dich zu sehen.

English:
Hudie, huh... Guess you really took a liking
to those guys.
Chinese:
這樣啊，hudie……
看來你很喜歡他們呢。
Korean:
그런가, 후디에인가…….
어지간히 마음에 들었구나, 그 녀석들
German:
Hudie, hm ... An denen hast du ja wirklich
Gefallen gefunden.

English:
K... You mean the hacker who told you about Shiga,
right? He hasn't contacted you since then, has he?
Chinese:
K……就是告訴你志賀的情報的駭客……對吧？
在那之後，他還有聯絡你嗎？
Korean:
K인가…… 너한테 시가의 정보를 알려준 해커…지.
그 이후론 연락이 오지 않았지?
German:
K ... Du meinst den Hacker, der dir von Shiga
erzählt hat? Er hat dich seitdem nicht
kontaktiert, oder?

English:
I don't know what he's after...but hopefully
you'll hear from him again.
Chinese: 雖然不知道他的目的……但要是他有聯絡就好了。
Korean: 뭐가 목적인지는 모르겠지만…… 연락이 왔으면 좋겠네
German:
Ich weiß nicht, was er will ... aber hoffentlich
meldet er sich wieder bei dir.

English:
Although something rubs me the wrong way about
having to wait for such a sketchy person to
contact you with info on the criminal...
Chinese:
但能找到犯人的情報，居然只能等那種
不知道來歷的傢伙聯絡，感覺真不舒服……
Korean:
범인으로 이어지는 정보를 그런 정체 모를 녀석의
연락에 의존해야 한다니 뭔가 기분 나쁘지만……
German:
Aber es ist schon komisch, dass du auf Kontakt
von einer so zwielichtigen Person wartest, um
Infos über den Verbrecher zu erhalten.

English:
Urk! I don't know how you say stuff like that
without batting an eyelid...
Chinese:
嗚……！！
我說你啊，別有時候就若無其事的說這種話啊……！
Korean:
핫……!!
너란 녀석은 가끔 아무렇지도 않게 그런 소리를 한다니까…!
German:
Argh! Ich weiß nicht, wie du so etwas sagen
kannst, ohne mit der Wimper zu zucken ...

English: ...Still, happy to help.
Chinese: ……雖然我是很高興啦。
Korean: ……뭐, 기쁘긴 하지만
German: ... Trotzdem helfe ich dir gern.

English: ...Hey, take me with you next time, okay?
Chinese: ……喂，這次我也跟你去喔。
Korean: ……야, 다음엔 나도 따라갈 거다
German: ... Hey, nimm mich beim nächsten Mal mit, ja?

English:
Don't look so shocked! I was gonna go with you to
the Black Market in the first place, you know!
Chinese:
你在吃驚什麼啊！
就算是黑市那次，我也是打算跟你一起去的啊。
Korean:
뭘 놀라는 거야!
난 암시장에도 같이 갈 생각이었어
German:
Jetzt schau nicht so geschockt! Ich wollte doch
ursprünglich auch zum Schwarzmarkt mitgehen!

English:
Then you went off without me...truth be told,
I was pretty shocked.
Chinese:
但你卻瞞著我自己一個人跑去……
我可是很受打擊啊。
Korean:
그런데도 말없이 혼자 가버리다니…….
상당히 쇼크였다고
German:
Dann bist du einfach ohne mich los ... Ehrlich
gesagt, war ich ganz schön geschockt.

English:
Next time K contacts you, be sure to let me know!
Pinky swear!
Chinese:
下次K再聯絡你的時候，一定要跟我聯絡啊。
說好了啊！
Korean:
다음에 K에게서 연락이 오면 꼭 나에게도 연락해.
약속이다!
German:
Wenn K dich das nächste Mal kontaktiert, sag mir
unbedingt Bescheid! Versprich es!

English: Good.
Chinese: 很好。
Korean: 좋아
German: Gut.

English:
All right, I'd better go. I feel better having
talked to you.
Chinese:
……那我就走了喔。
聽你說了這些後我安心多了。
Korean:
……그럼 난 이만 갈게.
이야기를 듣고 안심했어
German:
Also, ich muss jetzt los. Nach unserem Gespräch
geht es mir besser.

English: Don't forget your promise!
Chinese: 別忘記我們的約定喔！
Korean: 약속 잊지 말라고!
German: Vergiss nicht, was du versprochen hast!

English:
Sounds like I gave Yu quite a scare... I'd better
catch the criminal quickly for his sake, too.
Chinese:
看來讓優相當擔心……
為了他，一定要早點抓到犯人。
Korean:
유우에게 상당히 걱정을 끼쳐버린 모양이다…….
그 녀석을 위해서라도 빨리 범인을 잡자
German:
Da habe ich Yu wohl einen Schrecken eingejagt ...
Schon seinetwegen sollte ich den Verbrecher
schnell finden.
